titleStmt.title: [Letter] 1822 Oct. 10, Edwardsville [to] James Winchester, Cairo, Tennessee / P. Winchester : a machine readable transcription of an image
titleStmt.author: Winchester, P.

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: 1822 Oct. 10, Edwardsville [to] James Winchester, Cairo, Tennessee / P. Winchester
bibl.author: Winchester, P.
bibl.note: This is a letter to General James Winchester dated October 10, 1822. The author is a nephew of Winchester's. The author wishes to receive a job recommendation from General Andrew Jackson. He hopes that James Winchester can help him obtain this recommendation.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p: I have not written you for some time I write you on business of the first importance to me my Father in Law Died this day he was receiver of Publick money at this place I want the appointment if possible if I can get the recommendation of General Jackson who Stands high with the president I can get the appointment two members from this State will give me a zealous support and have wrote to the president I may get the other member I have not Seen him but will

I wish you would Send an express to Gen Jackson and if you are not intimate with him yet Serve one that is to write for me Should I get the appointment I can aid my mother same with my mother in Law & four children I shall have
to Support, the office was their support with and the Exertions of the acct &c if you ever wish to Serve me attend to this Jackson can get me the office the Support Governor Edwards I have he has wrote us very warmly in my favor you can refer any member you write to or any of the heads of Department to Edwards & Cook from this State for my claims suffer me warmly they are warmly my frends-

closer.add: Gov Edwards has wrote the President Jackson I wish you to write him them refer to Edwards & Cook form my pretentions
